name: Meliodon, Appellant, v. Philadelphia School District

judges: Before Schaffer, Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, and Barnes, JJ.
parties: Meliodon, Appellant, v. Philadelphia School District.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The decree of the chancellor dismissing plaintiff’s bill is affirmed on the portion of his opinion appearing in the Reporter’s notes.
Costs to be paid by appellant.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Joseph M. Barrett, with him Thomas J. Mullaney, of Hirst & Mullaney, for appellant.
Charles I. Thompson, with him Robert von Moschzisher, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Meliodon, Appellant, v. Philadelphia School District.
Argued November 24,1937.
Before Schaffer, Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, and Barnes, JJ.
Joseph M. Barrett, with him Thomas J. Mullaney, of Hirst & Mullaney, for appellant.
Charles I. Thompson, with him Robert von Moschzisher, for appellee.
January 3, 1938:
